attributes.comment:
As an International Student Advisor, I am extremely concerned about the doubling
of many fees associated with students possessing an F-1 or M-1 visa. While I
respect the inconvenience and cost to USCIS of replacing lost I-94 cards or
EADs, doubling the fees for these services is extreme. Inflation and supply costs
have certainly not doubled in the last several years and to charge students who
already pay out of state tuition higher fees for replacement documents is
unacceptable. Students at community colleges are often unable to obtain on-
campus employment and therefore are limited in their ability to earn additional
income like their counterparts at universities. In addition, these students are often
from less affluent families and the additional burden of these fees is tremendous.

Many of the other fee increases listed are even more extreme and while I cannot
speak to these professionally because I do not work with this population, I am
concerned at the seemingly arbitrary decisions and exhorbitant fee increases
being imposed upon a largely underemployed and struggling group of immigrants.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Rebecca Howell
